titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Judy Alter Accessions

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-23 12:48:17 -0500.

change.item: Revised for ArchivesSpace by Stephanie Forsythe

did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Judy Alter Accessions
did.physloc: Materials may be stored off-site. Advance notice is required for use: https://www.thewittliffcollections.txstate.edu/research/makearesearchappointment.html.
did.abstract: Judy Alter began donating her papers to the Southwestern Writers Collection/The Wittliff Collections in 1993. Alter writes for both adults and young readers and she is best known for her books on women and girls of the American West. Among her many honors are "best book" awards from the Texas Institute of Letters, the Western Writers of America, and the Western Heritage (Wrangler) Awards from the National Cowboy Museum. In 1996 the Dallas Morning News named her one of 100 Women Who Have Left Their Mark on Texas. In 2005 the Western Writers of America gave Alter the Owen Wister Award for Lifetime Achievement.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Judy Alter Accessions, The Wittliff Collections, Texas State University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Judy Alter Accessions, The Wittliff Collections, Texas State University.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Materials from the Wittliff Collections are made available for use in research, teaching, and private study. The user assumes responsibility for determining copyright status, obtaining permission to publish, and abiding by U.S. copyright laws. https://www.thewittliffcollections.txstate.edu/research/visit/policies/publication.html

scopecontent.head: Abstract
scopecontent.p: Research, manuscripts, correspondence and galley proofs for several works by Judy Alter, along with manuscripts for Alter's early unpublished novels. Also included are editorial files for Larry L. King's Golden Shadows Old West Museum, which was published in 1993 by Texas Christian University Press, where Judy Alter serves as Director.

scopecontent.head: Abstract
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to the writing career of Judy Alter

did.unittitle: Typed manuscript titled "Laura Ingalls Wilder: A Biography" by Judy Alter with note: "Never published - the editor at 'Grober' accused me of 'plagiarism' and I never got another assignment from them. It was a trumped-up charge leveled at several other writers at the same time, my lawyer wrote - it turned into quite a'brouhaha'."
Incomplete "untitled" typed manuscript, a sequel to "So Far from Paradise"
Annotated typed manuscript titled, "The (Faithful) Fearful Heart" by Judy Alter with note: "My one disastrous attempt at romance, trite!"
Typed manuscript titled, "Potter's Wife: A novel of Chicago" by Judy Alter; rejection letters
Typed manuscript titled, "Potter's Wife" by Judy Alter with note: "An early version of a novel I still hope will come to something"
Annotated manuscript titled, "Haley Goes to Camp" by Judy Alter with note: "This shows how far this had gone before publication was cancelled"
Annotated "untitled" typed manuscript by Judy Alter with note: "Publisher went out of business, book was never published. I had to get my lawyer to collect the 'Work-for-hire' fee"
Annotated page proofs for "Cissie Palmer: Putting Wealth to Work" by Judy Alter
Typed short story titled, "Prisoners", which was published in "Collective Heart"
Typed manuscript titled, "The Perfect Coed" by Judy Alter with note: "My first and so far, only attempt at my story- still want to do it", various reject letters from publishers
Annotated typed manuscript titled, "I Wish I Lived in Eleanor Lee's House" a novel by Judy Alter
Typed manuscript that was never published titled, "I Wish I Lived in Eleanor Lee's House" a novel by Judy Alter

Typed manuscript titled, "So Far from Paradise" a novel by Judy Alter with note: "This novel was commissioned by the 'Fort Worth Star Telegram' and ran serially as a part of their sesquicentennial features. Later submitted on request, to this development company which was booking for 'Disney' projects, I think"
List of books; short stories; reviews; columns; and articles written by Judy Alter

scopecontent.head: Abstract
scopecontent.p: Material consists mainly of "working files for children's books now in print". Research material consists of newspaper clippings, information from the internet, and photocopies from various books and other sources. In a few instances, original file folders were kept because of notes or other writings that appear on them. Folder 20 has been flagged for sensitive material.

scopecontent.head: Abstract
scopecontent.p: This donation consists of manuscript drafts and speeches written by author Judy Alter. Included in this collection are early drafts for Trouble in a Big Box, Danger Comes Home, No Neighborhood for Old Women, Cooking My Way Through Life with Kids & Books, and Texas is Chili Country. Also included is unpublished material related to "Gail Borden" and a Certificate of Copyright Registration for Great Texas Chefs.

scopecontent.p: Additional material for the Judy Alter archive. This donation contains correspondence 2011-2012, drafts, publicity, and reviews related to Alter's Kelly O'Connell mystery series.

scopecontent.p: This addition to Alter's collection includes a draft of The Perfect Coed, and various magazines in which her articles have been featured such as Louis L'amour Western Magazine, Texas Co-Op Power, and Roundup Magazine.

scopecontent.head: Abstract
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of additional material of Judy Alter's literary papers. The majority of the material within the collection is a series of books written by Judy Alter. Also included in the collection is many magazines, the majority being from or dealing with Fort Worth, Texas. Many newspapers are included in the collection, each containing an article about or written by Judy Alter. The folder titles preceding a semicolon reflect Alter's original description.
